wikipedia_page.main: Flight Lieutenant Edmund Roger Tempest  (30 October 1894 – 17 December 1921) was a British First World War flying ace credited with 17 aerial victories.

response: He would not score again until 19 July 1918, when he destroyed another Fokker triplane south of Lille. The next day, he, Edmund Tempest, and another pilot cooperated to ruin a Rumpler over Drocourt. On 22 July 1918, he won for the last time, destroying an Albatros D.V over Harnes. His final tally was six enemy airplanes destroyed solo, three more shared destructions, and two enemy fighter sent down out of control.

link_mentions.page: List of World War I flying aces from the British Empire

response: * Edmund Tempest (1894–1921), British First World War flying ace
**RAF Captain Edmund Tempest, 27, British flying ace during World War One with 17 victories, was killed in an accidental plane crash while serving in Baghdad.
